results.title: Missing Apostrophe in Facebook Post Lands a Man in Defamation Court
results.abstract: An Australian man claimed a real estate agent did not pay its “employees” retirement funds. The lack of a punctuation mark may cost him thousands.

results.title: Where Parents Have Abducted Their Own Children in a Bid for Custody
results.abstract: For years, thousands of children in China have been taken and hidden. The practice rose along with the nation’s divorce rate. A new law aims to curb the practice.
results.byline: By Amy Qin and Amy Chang Chien

multimedia.caption: Mothers playing with their children in Shanghai. Custody battles after a divorce can be especially acrimonious in China, where courts rarely grant joint physical custody.

results.title: At Mexico-U.S. Security Talks, Migration Question Is Largely Avoided
results.abstract: As diplomats from both countries began negotiating a new security agreement on Friday, the focus was on stopping criminal activity while the border crisis was conspicuously sidestepped.
results.byline: By Lara Jakes and Maria Abi-Habib

results.title: Court in Argentina Dismisses Charges Against Kirchner in Bombing Case
results.abstract: Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, now the vice president, had been accused of conspiring with Iran to thwart an investigation into a 1994 attack on a Jewish center in Buenos Aires.

multimedia.caption: Vice President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner last month in Buenos Aires. The ruling late Thursday is the latest legal victory for Mrs. Kirchner, who was president of Argentina from 2007 to 2015.
